golang-github-macaron-inject will be retired, if it still fails to build.

bugs.title: CVE-2020-36627 golang-github-macaron-inject: go-macaron: Open redirect vulnerability in go-macron [fedora-37]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-36627 golang-github-macaron-inject: go-macaron: Open redirect vulnerability in go-macron [fedora-37]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-36627 go-macaron: Open redirect vulnerability in go-macron

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in Macaron i18n. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file i18n.go. The manipulation leads to open redirect. The attack can be launched remotely. Upgrading to version 0.5.0 is able to address this issue. The name of the patch is 329b0c4844cc16a5a253c011b55180598e707735. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The identifier VDB-216745 was assigned to this vulnerability.

https://vuldb.com/?id.216745
https://github.com/go-macaron/i18n/releases/tag/v0.5.0
https://github.com/go-macaron/i18n/commit/329b0c4844cc16a5a253c011b55180598e707735

Created golang-github-macaron-binding tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2156662]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2156668]


Created golang-github-macaron-gzip tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2156663]


Created golang-github-macaron-inject tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2156664]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2156669]


Created golang-github-macaron-session tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2156665]


Created golang-gopkg-macaron-1 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2156666]


Created grafana tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2156667]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2156266

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2156266,2156669

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
